title: Run Supabase 100% LOCALLY for Your AI Agents
description:
The local AI package - which up until this point has included Ollama, n8n, Postgres, Qdrant, Open WebUI, and Flowise, is getting a revamp in this video with the long awaited addition of Supabase! Supabase is the most adopted database for AI agents right now, so it just made sense to include it in this package for all of you to level up your AI game. You can now use Supabase as SQL database (replacement for Postgres) and/or for RAG with PGVector (replacement for Qdrant).

In this video, I show you exactly how to get the new local AI package set up with Supabase. It’s not quite as simple as setting up the rest of the package but certainly worth it! We’ll even build a RAG AI agent that runs entirely locally using our new instance of Supabase (and the rest of the package as well).

I’ve got big plans for the local AI package (originally created by the n8n team) going forward and I’m planning on adding more tools/platforms to it in the near future! Let me know in the comments what you think should be included next!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Evolved Local AI package in GitHub:

https://github.com/coleam00/local-ai-packaged

Supabase self-hosting with Docker instructions:

https://supabase.com/docs/guides/self-hosting/docker

The original local AI starter kit developed by the n8n team:

https://github.com/n8n-io/self-hosted-ai-starter-kit

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

00:00 - Introducing Supabase to the Local AI Stack
02:01 - The Evolved Local AI Package
03:30 - Local AI Package Prerequisites
04:54 - Package Installation and Setup with Supabase
16:02 - Running the Local AI Stack
17:20 - Local AI Stack in Docker Desktop
18:46 - Troubleshooting Guide
19:15 - Overview of Local AI Services (Including Supabase)
20:33 - Local RAG AI Agent with n8n/Supabase/Ollama
47:55 - Local RAG AI Agent Demo
28:51 - Outro

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Join me as I push the limits of what is possible with AI. I'll be uploading videos at least two times a week - Sundays and Wednesdays at 7:00 PM CDT!
